result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jigyasa Richa Chander

records.addlTxt:
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services /s/ MDZ 11/03/22
(sent to DHSMMHI, WFU, & WCS-ss) 11-4-22 Confirmation received by DHSMMHI-ss
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services filed by Atty Taylor Soule (sent to Br 1 Judge on 11/02/22 sp)

1:35 PM Defendant Jigyasa Richa Chander appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Jigyasa Richa Chander.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court calls the case and states the appearances. 
This is a continued initial appearance for reasons stated on record.

Atty Jambois makes statements regarding competency report. 
Atty Soule makes statements regarding having a competency evaluation.
Court questions Atty Soule regarding residency for Ms. Chander.
Court explains to Ms. Chander why she was found in contempt on Monday. 
Ms. Chander responds.
Judge stops Ms. Chander and asks if she understands the process of court hearing as explained.
Ms. Chander responds further.

1:39 PM Judge asks the clerk to mute Ms. Chander as she appears by Zoom.
Clerk does so.

BY THE COURT: Purge condition for contempt based on letter and questions from today and can be released today.

Atty Jambois asks that Ms. Chander does not be released to her parents if she is released.
Atty Soule does not believe that she has nowhere else to go.
Atty Jambois makes further arguments regarding Ms. Chander staying with her parents. 

1:43 PM Ms. Chander makes statements and Court repeatedly asks her to stop talking as it is not her turn. 
Court asks that Clerk mutes Ms. Chander again.
Clerk complies.

Court questions Atty Jambois regarding his arguments.

Atty Soule is asking for one more chance for an out patient exam.
Atty Jambois responds and makes further arguments.

Court takes a look at a letter to see recommendation.
The document is for evaluator's report.
Court reviews such document.

Court states findings for the record. 

BY THE COURT: Bond is revoked.
Vacate contempt order and sentence, 
Be evaluated at a State facility for competency. 

State will prepare order.
Apology letter from Defendant to Court. Forwarded to Court. az
Hearing on November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:34 PM Defendant Jigyasa Richa Chander in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Jigyasa Richa Chander.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Matter is set for an adjourned initial appearance.

Court reviewed the file.
Court questions Counsel regarding the competency report.

Court addresses Defendant.
Atty Soule has a copy of the report, her client does wish withdrawal as counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not grant the request given circumstances at this point.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant in contempt.
30 days in jail, commencing immediately, purge by writing a letter of apology to the Court. 

If letter is written to the Court apologizing, Court would then purge the contempt.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services filed by Atty Taylor Soule (Sent to Br 2 Judge on 09/13/22 sp)

1:54 PM Defendant Jigyasa Richa Chander in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Jigyasa Richa Chander.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Atty Soule raises competency 
Atty Soule will not provide additional information to do client/attorney privilege. 
ADA Dodge has no objection to the competency issue.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Competency Hearing to be ordered
Defendant is ordered to comply with the competency evaluation.
Initial Appearance to be adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:57 PM Defendant Jigyasa Richa Chander not in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Jigyasa Richa Chander.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant fails to appear.
Atty Soule appears on her behalf.
Atty Soule is heard as to why her client does not appear.
Atty Soule wishes to request a competency examination.
Atty Soule would request an adjournment.

BY THE COURT: 
Bond is continued.
Competency issues to be renewed at the AIA on 09/12/22
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

1:28 PM Defendant Jigyasa R Chander appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI.   Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State has complied with victim notification rights.
State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
